description.narrative:
The Australia NGO Cooperation Program (ANCP) through Oxfam Australia supports project titled Inclusive Civil Society Participation in Water Governance in Mekong. Oxfam Mekong Regional Water Governance Project supports farming and fishing communities living along the Mekong River to have secure and sustainable livelihoods and access to water, food and energy by influencing the policies and practices of actors driving development processes. The project addresses the following key issues:
1) Women#s leadership. Women play important roles in providing, managing and safeguarding water and aquatic resources and are key contributors to local economies. Theyare the majority of the world#s poor and are disproportionately affected by climate change and disasters. Yet, they are under-represented in decision making on all aspects of water management, governance and leadership. This is largely due to gendered norms that restrict women#s representation at all levels.
2) Multi-stakeholder dialogue and engagement on water policy. This will focus on sustainable energy policy alternatives that will balance discussions on use of Mekong water resources. This builds upon experiences andthe long-term partnership with GreenID who will facilitate dialogue on promoting renewable energy, among interested NGOs, private companies providing alternative energy services, and communities, to discuss sustainable energy practices in Mekong countries. This dialogue will foster greater coordination, understanding and acceptance ofsustainable energy practices.
3) Youth Engagement. Young people constitute over 50% of the population in the Mekong region. They are the leaders of the future and those most likely to consider policy alternatives and issues of equality and environmental sustainability. Their engagement in decision making on development processes concerning their future is limited at all levels. This project will strengthen the capacity of young people to engage in and influence water resource policy discussions at local, national and regional levels.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project#s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
